resources.string: Select the location of the /dat folder where vesselData.xml is located. Warning: Changing the location while connected to a server will reset the connection.

Before you can use Artemis Messenger, you must have an Artemis server running. Open Artemis on your computer and click "Start Server". After that, enter the server\'s address into the Address bar at the top of your screen, then tap the Connect button on the right to connect to the server.

Artemis Messenger is a Comms client app designed to be used with Artemis Spaceship Bridge Simulator, developed by Thom Robertson. It will be your assistant in managing side missions, ally ships, stations and more.
Welcome to Artemis Messenger! If this is your first time using this app, this tutorial will teach you all you need to know about how to use it.

You will know that the connection was successful if the area around the Address bar turns green. You will probably all see text appear in the box below it; that is the ship selector box. Click it to switch to any of the eight ships; you will then assume a Comms role for that ship.

If you press the Home button on your phone to return to your Home menu, Artemis Messenger will keep running in the background. It will continue to receive information about side missions, allies and stations via a Comms service. This information will be shown as notifications on your phone. If you click on one of those notifications, you will return to Artemis Messenger.

When you want to leave Artemis Messenger, just hit the Back button on your phone. If your phone doesn\'t have a Back button, you can also press the Close button in the top-right corner of the screen. If the app is connected to a server, a dialog will appear asking if you want to close the connection; otherwise, no dialog will appear.
Special thanks to Robert J. Walker for writing the IAN (Interface for Artemis Networking) library, without which this app could not exist. IAN is available on GitHub.
